At Chelsea Place we had seats at the bar, were free to do irish car bombs at the drop of a hat, and free food!  They had corned beef sandwiches and potatoes in sternos, and the nice bartender also made us some popcorn...top notch customer service right there.
author: Michelle L.

description:
i have to say hmm about this place.  i never take the advise of yelp people, but this time i should have.  it's christmas and most places are closed, so i went to chelsea place.  at first, everything was cool.  there was a female asian bartender and she took my cash.  however, there was a shift change and two new really hot girls came in to bartend.  i gave them my credit card and i ordered a coors, two hornitos and a sierra.  i was charged for two coors, two HERRADURA which are $10/shot and a sierra.  the HERRADURA  is more expensive, but the bartenders claimed not to understand me.  frankly,  i worked in this industry, these women are great bartenders!  they can make any drink.  i knew i was being played.  by the way, the first girl only charged me $7 for the hornitos.  chelsea is such a fucking rip off.  i paid up and actually gave a tip since some of the so called locals that were being nice, stopped talking to me.  i took this to mean, get the fuck out or else!

on a side note, i was introduced to a guy by another guy who said this guy ownes these girls.  it was as if he was the pimp.  frankly, he probably was and i'm glad i left.

also, some guy from humbolt that was talking to me about 90's rap/snoop almost got into it with a guy from the UK traveling through on a boat.  

the conclusion here is i just wanted to watch chi and GB play football.  i didn't want this and i'll never go back.  

if drama is your thing, then go to chelsea place.
author: T D.

description:
a friend and i stopped by here to wait for tunnel top to open one friday evening.  i guess we were ready to drink a bit too early.  chelsea place is not a nice bar by any means but there were two korean lady bartenders, probably about my mom's age, so it made me homesick.  

my mom is not a bartender, nor does she drink, nor would she appreciate me thinking of her in a dive like that, but something about being spoken to in korean and responding in korean and english, made me long for home.  it probably wasn't as fun for my non korean friend.

back to the bar, i had vodka tonics.  they were tight.
author: Seong P.

description: We came here for a few drinks after getting the recommendation from one of my boyfriends coworkers who works for the same beer company. I wish I would have looked at some of the reviews to see what we were getting ourselves into. Just kidding! This place was cool and divey- there were asian girls dancing behind the bar as they smoked cigarettes and served you drinks. It was like the San Diego version of the star bar! Everyone seemed friendly- drinks were reasonable- but I know now for sure how much I like bars that they don't let you smoke in.
author: Amy C.

description: What a pleasant place.  Great jukebox, staff, and clientele.  Always a good time.  It's kicked me out of bad moods before.
author: Ed B.

description:
Been coming here for 15 years and I love it.
Definitely not a chick's bar. Say hi to lovely Jennifer the owner and have a drink with her or one of the charming bartenders. 

This is like most of the other Korean bars in the Tenderloin area, but it is frequented by more tourists, which can be fun if you like Europeans. Their Draft Beers are very good, and the Hefeweisen is always served with a lemon, so whenever I am in the city to the North, I always stop by Chelsea Place for a cold one.
author: Tim S.

description: Popcorn, eclectic jukebox and dancing girls behind the bar. What more could you ask from a dive bar? Oh yeah, just up the street from our newly smoking-ban-enforced favorite Tunnel Top.
author: Susanna H.

description: yeah - a solid 3 star, for the secret smoking bar, but it is a little spendy and for this I am stymied...
author: david s.

description: a wholly enjoyable dive. if you just want a relaxing drink with some friends that won't be super noisy or expensive, this should work for you. velvet paintings of nude korean women will greet you from the walls, and getting to the bathroom is like a journey to the center of the earth. great place to land after spending too much at the tonga room.
author: Tom H.
